intro: Hiraea propinqua, commonly known as the small hiraea, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and thrives in humid, shaded environments. The plant features small, delicate leaves and produces clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It is often found in moist woodlands and along stream banks. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and somewhat elusive species.
